intro: Couepia williamsii, commonly known as the Williams' couepia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Central and South America, particularly found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Couepia williamsii is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral structure.
